dt: {bc}to draw (something, such as liquid) into the mouth through a suction force produced by movements of the lips and tongue
{bc}to draw something from or consume by such movements
{bc}to apply the mouth to in order to or as if to suck out a liquid
{bc}to draw by or as if by suction

dt.t: when a receding wave {wi}sucks{/wi} the sand from under your feet

dt: {bc}to take in and consume by or as if by suction

dt.t: opponents say that malls {wi}suck{/wi} the life out of downtown areas

dt: {bc}to draw something in by or as if by exerting a suction force
{bc}to draw milk from a breast or udder with the mouth
{bc}to make a sound or motion associated with or caused by suction

dt.t: flanks {wi}sucked{/wi} in and out, the long nose resting on his paws
when they want votes … the candidates come {wi}sucking{/wi} around

dt: {bc}to make the effort required to do or deal with something difficult or unpleasant

et: Middle English {it}suken{/it}, from Old English {it}sūcan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}sūgan{/it} to suck, Latin {it}sugere{/it}
shortdef: to draw (something, such as liquid) into the mouth through a suction force produced by movements of the lips and tongue
to draw something from or consume by such movements
to apply the mouth to in order to or as if to suck out a liquid

dt: {bc}to contract, flatten, and tighten (the abdomen) especially by inhaling deeply

shortdef: to contract, flatten, and tighten (the abdomen) especially by inhaling deeply

dt: {bc}a person who is ingratiating or fawning

shortdef: a person who is ingratiating or fawning

dt: {bc}to try something in order to find out if it is good, effective, etc.

dt.t: We don't know if it will work. We'll have to just {it}suck it and see{/it}.

shortdef: to try something in order to find out if it is good, effective, etc.

dt: {bc}an activity to which one devotes a lot of time that might be better or more productively spent doing other things

dt.t: Yes, it's no secret that Twitter can be a tremendous {wi}time-suck{/wi}. But imagine getting paid for wasting those precious minutes of your day.

The electronic plate would update automatically to show your current registration. This is mildly convenient for regular folks but super convenient for fleets. Gingerly applying stickers to dozens of cars seems like it would be a real {wi}time-suck{/wi}.
Adversity can inspire great art, but it can also be a {wi}time suck{/wi}. For more than twenty years, Matthew Covey has been helping musicians and other artists deal with government paperwork.

shortdef: an activity to which one devotes a lot of time that might be better or more productively spent doing other things

dt: {bc}to take or use up everything from (someone or something)

dt.t: He married her for her money and then {it}bled{/it} her {it}dry{/it}.

shortdef: to take or use up everything from (someone or something)
